properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 2 at 1:48PM MST until February 4 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE TUSAS MOUNTAINS...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to the Tusas Mountains
starting mid day Monday, and continuing through Tuesday. Up to 10
inches of snowfall is possible across the peaks and west facing
slopes. Much of the snowfall will occur Monday afternoon and
evening, but light snow may continue off and on through Tuesday.
High terrain roadways will become snowpacked and icy.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches,
except 5 to 10 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as
35 mph on Monday.

* WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama.

* WHEN...From 11 AM Monday to 6 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing snow
may reduce visibility Monday afternoon and evening below 2
miles. Travelling along Highway 64 may become difficult.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MONDAY TO 6 PM MST TUESDAY
